title: NY Attorney General Letitia James Indicted on Bank Fraud Charges
snippets: The indictment accuses James on two felony counts: bank fraud and making false statements to a financial institution.
James had been a target of US President Trump since successfully suing him for overstating his wealth to dupe lenders.
James had previously sued Donald Trump and his company for fraud while he was running for office. She accused the Trump administration of a "desperate weaponization" of the US justice system.
Read: N.Y. AG Letitia James' indicted on 2 charges Axios
New York AG Letitia James indicted for alleged bank fraud Axios
New York Attorney General Letitia James previously sued President Trump in a civil case that led to him and his company being held liable for business fraud.
Case comes after president urged Department of Justice to take legal action against top prosecutor
NY Attorney General Letitia James Indicted Over Fraud Claims Bloomberg.com

A grand jury has indicted New York Attorney General Letitia James on a fraud charge in the latest Justice Department case against a perceived enemy of President Donald Trump, a person familiar with the matter told The Associated Press on Thursday. James was indicted in the Eastern District of Virgin
James infuriated President Donald Trump by suing him and his company for fraud in a case that played out as he was running for office.

summary: New York Attorney General Letitia James, known for suing President Trump and his company for business fraud, has been indicted on charges of bank fraud. These charges come after Trump urged the Department of Justice to act against her, marking a significant legal development against a prominent critic of the former president.

title: Israel, Hamas Agree on Ceasefire in US-Brokered Peace Deal
snippets: Explosions and smoke were seen in Gaza on Friday, with attacks taking place after Israel’s gov't approved the ceasefire.
Israel's government has approved the plan for the 'release of all captives' fighting in Gaza to stop within 24 hours.

The Israeli military is expected to pull back to new lines within Gaza as part of the deal that also sees the release of Israeli hostages. The US will deploy 200 troops to monitor its implementation. DW has the latest.
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s cabinet votes for the first phase of Donald Trump’s peace deal
Trump’s framework to end the war in Gaza is the basis for an initial agreement between Israel and Hamas.
Israel and the militant group Hamas agreed to the first phase of a deal involving an exchange of Israeli hostages in Gaza and Palestinian detainees.
Israel Says Gaza Ceasefire Now in Effect After Hostage Deal Bloomberg.com
titles: Attacks on Gaza continue after Israel agrees ceasefire
LIVE: Hamas gets guarantees of end to Gaza war, Israel approves ceasefire
Middle East: Israel approves Gaza ceasefire deal
Israel approves Gaza ceasefire and hostage release
What to know about the Gaza ceasefire deal
Celebrations erupt over Israel-Hamas ceasefire in Gaza
Israel Says Gaza Ceasefire Now in Effect After Hostage Deal - Bloomberg.com
summary: Israel and Hamas have agreed to the first phase of a peace deal brokered by the US, aiming to end hostilities in Gaza. The deal, approved by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's cabinet, includes a ceasefire and the exchange of Israeli hostages for Palestinian prisoners. This agreement marks a significant step towards resolving the two-year conflict, with the ceasefire now in effect.

title: Judge Halts Trump's Plan to Deploy National Guard in Illinois
snippets: A US federal judge has issued a temporary restraining order blocking Trump from sending National Guard soldiers to Illinois as part of a sweeping crime and immigration clampdown. The order will last until October 23.
Judge rules against Trump's federalization of National Guard in Chicago Axios
Officials in Oregon and Illinois had challenged the Trump administration’s push to dispatch the National Guard in both states.

Much-anticipated judgment centers on efforts by Trump administration to use troops to aid immigration crackdown A judge has temporarily blocked the Trump administration from federalizing or deploying the national guard in Illinois after Donald Trump ordered hundreds of troops to Chicago to help with
The judge called the Department of Homeland Security’s assessment of protests in the Chicago area “unreliable.”
titles: US: Judge temporarily blocks Trump's National Guard deployment in Illinois
Judge rules against Trump's federalization of National Guard in Chicago - Axios
Judge blocks Trump from deploying troops in Illinois for now
Judge temporarily blocks Trump’s effort to deploy national guard in Chicago
Judge Blocks Trump’s Chicago National Guard Deployment For Two Weeks
summary: A US federal judge has issued a temporary restraining order preventing President Trump from deploying National Guard soldiers to Illinois, aimed at addressing crime and immigration issues. This decision, effective until October 23, came after legal challenges in multiple states against the Trump administration's efforts to use troops in Democratic-led cities. The judge criticized the Department of Homeland Security's assessment of protests in Chicago as "unreliable."

title: Loyola Chicago's Chaplain Sister Jean Passes at 106
snippets: Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt, the longtime chaplain of the Loyola-Chicago men's basketball team, died Thursday at the age of 106. "[She] was an invaluable source of wisdom and grace for generations of students, faculty, and staff," the school said.
Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt gained national attention during the men's team run to the 2018 Final Four
Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt Dies At Age 106, Spent 31 Years as Loyola Chicago Chaplain Bleacher Report

Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt, the chaplain for the men’s basketball team at Loyola Chicago who became a beloved international celebrity during the school’s fairy-tale run to the Final Four of the NCAA Tournament in 2018, has died, the university announced Thursday night.
titles: Sister Jean, beloved Loyola-Chicago chaplain, dies
Sister Jean dies at 106: Legendary Loyola basketball chaplain and March Madness icon passes away
Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt Dies At Age 106, Spent 31 Years as Loyola Chicago Chaplain - Bleacher Report
Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt, Loyola Chicago’s beloved chaplain, dies at 106
summary: Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt, the beloved chaplain of Loyola Chicago's men's basketball team, passed away at 106. Known for her inspirational role during the team's 2018 Final Four run, she served 31 years, touching many lives at the university.

title: Global Eyes on Nobel Peace Prize Amid Speculation Over Trump's Reaction
snippets: Anticipation is growing and bookies around the world are taking bets on who'll be awarded this year's Nobel Peace Prize. Here is what to know ahead of the award announcement this week.
The prestigious award will be announced at the Norwegian Nobel Institute in Oslo at 09:00 GMT.
The Nobel Peace Prize has been awarded 105 times to 142 laureates in its 124 year history.
The world awaits the announcement of the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize winner. Anticipation is high this year due to US President Donald Trump's eagerness to receive the prize. Follow DW for the latest.

Donald Trump insists he wins the prize, which will be announced on Friday. These five people decide who gets it.

With hours to go until the announcement of this year’s Nobel peace prize, Norwegian politicians were steeling themselves for p

summary: Global anticipation builds for the Nobel Peace Prize announcement, with speculation on potential winners. Amidst this, there's focus on President Trump's intense interest in the prize, believed to be a motivator in his efforts to broker peace deals in Ukraine and Gaza. Concerns are raised about Trump's possible reactions if not awarded, including imposing tariffs, demanding higher NATO contributions, or declaring Norway an enemy, according to analysts.

title: Peru Impeaches President Boluarte, José Jerí Sworn in as Interim Leader
snippets: Lawmakers voted overwhelmingly to swiftly remove Peru's first female president shortly after midnight, marking yet another leadership shake-up in a nation rocked by violence and political turmoil.
Unlike eight previous attempts to remove the president, almost all legislative factions expressed support for the move.

Peruvian lawmakers voted to remove President Dina Boluarte, who has been criticized for her failure to address the rising crime rate. A Congress leader was sworn in as interim president until the April 2026 elections.

Congress leader José Jerí sworn in as interim president as majority of lawmakers initiate impeachment against Boluarte Lawmakers in Peru have voted to remove the president, Dina Boluarte, whose term has been marked by protests and accusations of failing to stem crime. Boluarte refused to appear befo
titles: Peru's Congress removes President Boluarte as a crime wave grips the country
Peru’s Congress votes to remove President Boluarte as crime grips nation
Peru: Congress votes to remove President Boluarte
Peru lawmakers vote to oust president Dina Boluarte over crime crisis
summary: Peruvian lawmakers voted to impeach President Dina Boluarte, marking a significant political change in a country facing violence and instability. This decision, supported by almost all legislative factions, follows Boluarte's criticized handling of rising crime rates. José Jerí, a Congress leader, was sworn in as interim president until the April 2026 elections, succeeding Boluarte who faced protests and accusations during her term.

title: LeBron James Sidelined 3-4 Weeks with Sciatica, to Miss NBA Season Start
snippets: Lakers star LeBron James will be sidelined an additional three to four weeks because of sciatica on his right side, the team announced Thursday.
Los Angeles Lakers star LeBron James will be sidelined for the next 3-4 weeks with a sciatica on his right side, according to ESPN’s Shams Charania.
LeBron James to Miss Lakers' Season Opener While Dealing With Injury Sports Illustrated

The Los Angeles Lakers announced on Thursday that star forward LeBron James will miss at least three to four weeks due to sciatica on his right side, ruling him out for the start of the 2025-26 NBA season.
titles: LeBron out 3-4 weeks, set to miss Lakers opener
Lakers Star LeBron James Sidelined For 3-4 Weeks With Sciatica

LeBron James sidelined due to sciatica, to miss Lakers’ season-opener
summary: Los Angeles Lakers' LeBron James will be out for 3-4 weeks due to sciatica on his right side, missing the start of the 2025-26 NBA season. This was confirmed by the team and reported by various sports news outlets including ESPN and Sports Illustrated.

title: 7.4 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Mindanao, Philippines; Tsunami Warnings Issued
snippets: One person has died from Friday's earthquake, which comes a week after a deadly quake hit the island of Cebu.
An offshore earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 7.4 hit off a southern Philippine province Friday morning and a tsunami was possible nearby
The quake, centered off the coast of Mindanao, struck at 9:43 a.m. local time but the extent of the damage was not immediately clear.
The 7.4-magnitude quake struck off the eastern coast of Mindanao island on Friday morning. A tsunami warning was issued, but it was later canceled.
titles: Strong 7.4 magnitude quake hits southern Philippines
7.4-magnitude earthquake strikes offshore from southern Philippines
Powerful 7.4-magnitude earthquake rocks southern Philippines
Two Dead After Powerful Earthquake Strikes Southern Philippines
summary: A magnitude 7.4 earthquake occurred off the east coast of Mindanao, Philippines, prompting tsunami warnings in the Philippines and Indonesia. Evacuations were ordered due to the potential for hazardous waves up to 3 meters high within 300km of the epicenter. The situation is being closely monitored with warnings of possible significant impacts in the affected regions.

title: Rookie Matthew Schaefer to Debut with Islanders Against Penguins

title: Rookies Dart and Skattebo Propel Giants to 34-17 Win Over Eagles
snippets: Jaxson Dart led the Giants to a convincing 34-17 win over the Eagles on Thursday night, a victory that they hope begins to change the perception of the team, which went 3-14 last season.
Jaxson Dart and Cam Skattebo help the New York Giants to a 34-17 win over defending Super Bowl champions the Philadelphia Eagles.

Cam Skattebo ran for three touchdowns as he and fellow rookie Jaxson Dart shone in prime time, and the New York Giants defeated the Philadelphia Eagles 34-17 on Thursday night to hand the defending Super Bowl champions their second consecutive loss.
titles: Dart, Giants hope win over Eagles shifts narrative
Rookies Dart & Skattebo star as Giants stun Eagles
Skattebo runs for three touchdowns as Giants stun Eagles in primetime
summary: Rookies Jaxson Dart and Cam Skattebo led the New York Giants to a 34-17 victory over the Philadelphia Eagles on Thursday night. Dart's leadership and Skattebo's three touchdowns were pivotal in the win against the defending Super Bowl champions, marking a significant improvement for the Giants from their 3-14 record last season. This victory handed the Eagles their second consecutive loss.

title: Dominion Voting Systems Acquired by Liberty Vote, Led by Ex-GOP Official

title: U.S. Agrees to $20 Billion Currency Swap to Aid Argentina's Economy
snippets: The Trump administration will purchase pesos in a bid to calm Argentina's economic crisis.
US Launches Financial Rescue of Argentina, Treasury Buys Pesos Bloomberg.com
Washington has finalized a $20 billion currency swap framework with Argentina’s central bank, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said in a social media post.

summary: The Trump administration has initiated a financial rescue for Argentina by agreeing to a $20 billion currency swap deal. This move, aimed at stabilizing Argentina's economic crisis, involves the U.S. Treasury purchasing pesos. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent announced the agreement on social media.

title: Taiwan to Boost Air Defense, Military Spending Amid China Threats

title: Canadiens Bounce Back with 5-1 Win; NHL Roundup Highlights Key Victories
snippets: Montreal should not have been the fresher of the two teams, after travelling overnight after their loss to Toronto, but they were. Brian Wilde has more.
Mike Matheson scored a goal and recorded an assist while Jakub Dobes saved 30 of the 31 shots he faced as the Montreal Canadiens defeated the Detroit Red Wings 5-1.
Shane Pinto scored the go-ahead goal with under two minutes to go in the third period as the Ottawa Senators defeated the Tampa Bay Lightning 5-4.
Mikko Rantanen had a goal and two assists as the Dallas Stars held on to beat Kyle Connor and the Winnipeg Jets 5-4.

Casey Mittelstadt, Elias Lindholm and Tanner Jeannot found the back of the net, while Fraser Minten buried the game-winning goal in overtime, to help the Boston Bruins beat the Chicago Blackhawks 4-3.
Evgeni Malkin opened the scoring and Harrison Brunicke notched his first NHL goal as the Pittsburgh Penguins beat the New York Islanders 4-3.

Jack Eichel scored his second goal of the young season and added an assist, Reilly Smith buried the overtime winner off an Alex Nedeljkovic gaffe, and the Vegas Golden Knights took a 4-3 win over the San Jose Sharks.
titles: Call of the Wilde: Montreal Canadiens dominate Detroit Red Wings 5-1 in home opener
NHL Highlights: Canadiens 5, Red Wings 1
NHL Highlights: Senators 5, Lightning 4
NHL Highlights: Stars 5, Jets 4
NHL Highlights: Bruins 4, Blackhawks 3 (OT)
NHL Highlights: Penguins 4, Islanders 3
NHL Highlights: Golden Knights 4, Sharks 3 (OT)
summary: Despite traveling overnight after a loss to Toronto, the Montreal Canadiens showed resilience by defeating the Detroit Red Wings 5-1, with Mike Matheson contributing a goal and an assist. In other NHL action, the Ottawa Senators edged out the Tampa Bay Lightning 5-4, the Boston Bruins won against the Chicago Blackhawks 4-3 in overtime, the Pittsburgh Penguins beat the New York Islanders 4-3, the New York Rangers shut out the Buffalo Sabres 4-0, the Florida Panthers overcame the Philadelphia Flyers 2-1, and the Carolina Hurricanes triumphed over the New Jersey Devils 6-3.

title: Dodgers Beat Phillies 2-1, Advance to NLCS After 11th-Inning Error
snippets: The Dodgers beat the Phillies 2-1 on Thursday to advance to the NLCS. The Phillies' Orion Kerkering made a wild throw past home instead of throwing to first after mishandling a bases-loaded comebacker with two outs in the 11th inning.
Watch as the Los Angeles Dodgers walk off their way to the NLCS after Phillies’ Orion Kerkering can’t make a clean throw to home.

Orion Kerkering made a wild throw past home instead of tossing to first after mishandling Andy Pages’ bases-loaded comebacker with two outs in the 11th inning, and the Los Angeles Dodgers beat the Philadelphia Phillies 2-1 Thursday to win their NL Division Series 3-1.
titles: Dodgers advance to NLCS after Kerkering's error
Gotta See It: Dodgers advance to NLCS off Kerkering’s wild throw
Dodgers eliminate Phillies after Kerkering’s wild throw in extras
summary: The Los Angeles Dodgers advanced to the NLCS by defeating the Philadelphia Phillies 2-1 on Thursday. The victory was secured in the 11th inning when Phillies' Orion Kerkering made a critical error, throwing wildly past home plate instead of to first base, following a mishandled bases-loaded comebacker. This allowed the Dodgers to win their NL Division Series 3-1.

summary: Wales is set to play a crucial 2026 World Cup qualifier against Belgium at Cardiff City Stadium on Monday. This follows a friendly loss to England, with the team now focusing on the upcoming match. This game is significant for Wales' hopes of qualifying for the World Cup.

As more sites require IDs for user age verification, expect more such breaches to come.

Discord says hackers stole government IDs of 70,000 users

snippets: Fewer than two dozen hostages are believed to be alive in Gaza, including a student, a software tester, a bartender and several soldiers.

title: French Court Increases Dogan's Sentence to 10 Years for Rape
snippets: Husamettin Dogan loses appeal after jury at retrial finds him guilty of raping Pelicot while she was sedated A man has been found guilty on appeal of raping Gisèle Pelicot after she was drugged unconscious by her husband – and has had his prison sentence increased to 10 years. Husamettin Dogan , 44,
One of the dozens of men convicted of raping Gisèle Pelicot appealed his verdict, but a French court again found him guilty.
titles: French appeal court increases sentence of Gisèle Pelicot rapist
Another Guilty Verdict After Appeal in Gisèle Pelicot Rape Case
summary: A French appeals court has found Husamettin Dogan, 44, guilty of raping Gisèle Pelicot after she was drugged by her husband. Initially convicted, Dogan's sentence was increased to 10 years upon losing his appeal.
